N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 403.7 - Residency

State Regulations
(a) No requirements
as to duration of residence or citizenship shall be imposed as a condition of
participation in a services program. (b) An alien who is unlawfully residing in
the United States or who fails to furnish evidence that he/she is lawfully
residing in the United States, shall not be eligible for any social services
except information and referral services and protective services for adults and
children. (c) An individual who has
been granted indefinite voluntary departure or indefinite stay of deportation
under "color of law" shall for the purpose of eligibility determinations for
title XX services, be considered an alien lawfully admitted for permanent
residence in the United States. Such an individual shall therefore be eligible
to apply for any social services as provided by the district component of the
then effective comprehensive annual social services program plan. (d) No child who is a United States citizen
or who is lawfully residing in the United States shall be denied any social
service for which the child is otherwise eligible because of the residency
status of the child's parents or custodial relatives. Notes
